title: On geometrically $C_1$ fields
abstract:
A field $k$ is called geometrically $C_1$ if every smooth projective
separably rationally connected $k$-variety has a $k$-rational point. Given a
henselian valued field of equal characteristic $0$ with divisible value group,
we show that the property of being geometrically $C_1$ lifts from the residue
field to the valued field. We also prove that algebraically maximal valued
fields with divisible value group and finite residue field are geometrically
$C_1$. In particular, any maximal totally ramified extension of a local field
is geometrically $C_1$.
